Detailed Description

A Database field containing a typed value. A Field object represents a specific field in a database row. It can be used to access the value of the field, modify the value, and convert the value to other types.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ fieldno()

db_fieldno_t storage::data::Field::fieldno ( ) const
inline

Position of the field in the row.

Returns
Field index number

◆ type()

db_vartype_t storage::data::Field::type ( ) const
inline

Data type of the field.

Returns
  • Field data type.

  • NULL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid input parameter.

◆ exists()

bool storage::data::Field::exists ( ) const
inline

Check if the field exists in the row.

Returns
  • true if the field exists
  • false if the field does not exist

◆ is_null()

bool storage::data::Field::is_null ( ) const
inline

Check to see if the field has null value.

Returns
  • true if the field has null value
  • false if the field doesnot have null value

◆ set_null()

db_result_t storage::data::Field::set_null ( )
inline

Set the field value to null.

Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid row handle.
    • DB_EFIELD Field identified by nfield does not exist.
Note
To make a field not null, use set().

◆ set_field()

db_result_t storage::data::Field::set_field ( const Field &  o)
inline

Set the field to the value of another field. Type conversion is attempted if the other field has a different type.

Parameters
oAnother field to be copied
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid row handle.
    • DB_EFIELD Field error.Invalid field number.
    • DB_ECONVERT Conversion is not possible (Incompatible types).
    • DB_EBINDSIZE Invalid bind size.

◆ get() [1/2]

template<typename T >
db_len_t storage::data::Field::get ( T &  value) const
inline

Get the value of the field and store it into a variable. The type T must support Bind Traits.

Returns
Length of the returned data,
  • DB_FIELD_NULL if null, or
  • DB_LEN_FAIL on failure.

◆ set() [1/2]

template<typename T >
db_result_t storage::data::Field::set ( const T &  value)
inline

Set the value of the field from a variable. The type T must support Bind Traits.

Parameters
valueValue with type T
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid row handle.
    • DB_EFIELD Field error.Invalid field number.
    • DB_ECONVERT Conversion is not possible (Incompatible types).
    • DB_EBINDSIZE Invalid bind size.

◆ to()

template<typename T >
T storage::data::Field::to ( const T &  default_value = T()) const
inline

Return the value of the field by casting to type T. The type T must support BindTraits.

Parameters
default_valueIf an error occurs, default_value is returned instead. default_value is also returned if the field is null and the type T is not Nullable.
Returns
value of the field

◆ get() [2/2]

db_len_t storage::data::Field::get ( db_vartype_t  ctype,
void *  dest,
db_len_t  size 
) const
inline

Copy the value of the field to dest, a pointer to a variable of the type specified by ctype.

Parameters
ctypeVariable type of the dest buffer.
destPointer to a buffer where the returned value is to be stored.
sizeLength of dest buffer in bytes.
Returns
Length of the returned data,
  • DB_FIELD_NULL if null, or
  • DB_LEN_FAIL on failure.

◆ set() [2/2]

db_result_t storage::data::Field::set ( db_vartype_t  ctype,
const void *  source,
db_len_t  len 
)
inline

Set the value for the field from source, a pointer to a variable of the type specified by ctype.

Parameters
ctypeVariable type of the source buffer.
sourcePointer to a buffer that contains a value.
lenLength of source buffer in characters or bytes, depending on type.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid row handle.
    • DB_EFIELD Field error.Invalid field number.
    • DB_ECONVERT Conversion is not possible (Incompatible types).
    • DB_EBINDSIZE Invalid bind size.
